edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgnmntFINAL

Class Spy

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_assgnmntFINAL.Spy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BallOfEnergy, java.io.Serializable

    public class Spy
extends java.lang.Object
implements BallOfEnergy, java.io.Serializable
    The spy class, or otherwise known as the player class, is the main protagonist of the game world, the hero that is to be controlled by the one who is going to play. The player is given certain advantages, that is to move one direction in any direction for his/her turn, to shoot and kill an enemy if he/she so desires, and to check rooms for the documents to win the game overall. Of course, the player is given three lives to complete their goal, if an enemy was to kill the player, the player would lose a life and start back to square one. If they lose all lives, the game is lost.
    Author:
    Mario Garcia, Anuja Joshi, Michelle Duoung, Matthew Musquiz, Kristin Adachi
    See Also:

      • takeLife

        public void takeLife()
        if a player is to be stabbed by an enemy in the grid, then this method will be called to remove a life from the player. If the player has zero lives left, then the player is presumed dead and the game is lost.

      • look

        public boolean look(int number,
                    java.lang.Object[][] n,
                    Enemy[] enemys,
                    Room[] rooms,
                    PowerUp[] powerups)
        Look method that is used for the player to look around in the direction they desire, two spaces ahead of their position. If an enemy, or powerup is within the player's line of sight upon looking, they will be revealed and the symbols representing the objects will be displayed for the player to see. This will trigger the warnings that an enemy is nearby the player.
        Parameters:
        number - - the direction that the player chooses to look at.
        n - - the grid used that the player stands in.
        enemys - - the enemies that will be used to check if they are revealed by the player.
        rooms - - the rooms that will be used to block off the sight range of the player.
        powerups - - power ups that will be checked. If the player spots any power up, they too will be revealed.
        Returns:
        - spotted - determines whether an enemy is nearby, which will trigger a warning for the player to watch out.

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        This method will return the row coordinates that player is set in.
        Specified by:
        getRow in interface BallOfEnergy
        Returns:
        row - the current row that the player sits in.

      • gainBullets

        public void gainBullets(int bullets)
        Allows for the player to recieved an additional bullet. Used by the ammo increase power up, if the player activates it.
        Parameters:
        bullets - - the number of bullets the player currently has.

      • getBullets

        public int getBullets()

        Returns:

      • shoot

        public int shoot(int number,
                 Enemy[] enemys,
                 java.lang.Object[][] n)
        The shoot method is used to allow the player to fire their bullet in the direction they so choose. If the bullet crosses the path of an enemy, the enemy will be killed, and the enemy killed will no longer be used for the duration of the game. If the player attempts to fire their gun with no bullets, the player is not allowed to fire anymore, and they will waste a turn in doing so.
        Parameters:
        number - - the direction that the player whats to shoot.
        enemys - - used to check which enemies will be caught in the path of the bullet.
        n - - the grid used to determine where the player stands.
        Returns:
        counter - determines how many enemies where killed in the crossing of the bullet.

        public javax.swing.JLabel getLabel()
